de.geofencing.event

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.geofencing.event.Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ModifyCounterEvent, NotificationEvent

    public abstract class Event
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Event class can be derived with instruction which should be executed, if the users behavior matches with the defined Trigger. Therefore the instructions has to be implemented in the trigger method. The Method onAddToGeofence can be overwritten with instructions, which should be executed, when the event is added to the Geofence. The Event is identified by the eventID, described by the description and is assigned to an Geofence. ClassType shows the class of the derivation for serializing.
    Author:
    Markus Thral
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Creates new Event an set class as classType
        Parameters:
        description - Description of the Event
        minor - Minor of the Geofence
        trigger - Trigger object which describes the behavior of the device to trigger the Event

      • checkTrigger

        public void checkTrigger(Trigger.Direction direction,
                         int deviceID)
        Checks if the conditions of the Trigger is fulfilled and triggers the Event
        Parameters:
        direction - Direction of the movement of the Device
        deviceID - DeviceID of the updating Device

      • onAddToGeofence

        public boolean onAddToGeofence()
        Can be overwritten with instructions which should be executed when the Event is added to the Geofence. If the method returns false, the event couldn't be added to the Geofence
        Returns:
        true if adding succeeded, false if not

      • jsonToEvent

        public static Event jsonToEvent(java.lang.String json)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Deserializes Event or a derivation from a JSON String
        Parameters:
        json - JSON String containing a serialized Event or a derivation
        Returns:
        Deserialized Event object or a derivation (has to be casted)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class type of the JSON String is not existing
